snippet: Mr. Zuckerberg set up a limited liability company, which has reaped enormous benefits as public relations coup and will help minimize his tax bill.
abstract: The Trade column; Facebook chief Mark Zuckerberg, by creating limited liability company to donate 99 percent of his $45 billion fortune to charity, scores public relations coup that also greatly cuts his taxes.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Zuckerberg set up a limited liability company, which has reaped enormous benefits as public relations coup and will help minimize his tax bill.

headline.main: How Mark Zuckerberg’s Altruism Helps Himself
